Title: reinterpretAsInt128
Description: Performs byte reinterpretation by treating the input value as a value of type Int128. Unlike CAST, the function does not attempt to preserve the original value - if the target type is not able to represent the input type, the output is meaningless.
x: value to byte reinterpret as Int128. (U)Int*, Float, Date, DateTime, UUID, String or FixedString.
Reinterpreted value x as Int128. Int128.
Examples: SELECT    toInt64(257) AS x,    toTypeName(x),    reinterpretAsInt128(x) AS res,    toTypeName(res);
